page.title: 09Blakedown Health Provision
page.content: If a resident of Blakedown falls ill, if the case is serious, the patient is taken to{Kidderminster General {Hospital}for treatment. If the complaint is not so serious then the patient will visit their{G.P.(General {Practitioner),}but this means a trip to Kidderminster as there is not a doctor's surgery in Blakedown.{Old {people}are treated at{Mill Street {Geriatric Hospital,}Kidderminster. {Mentally handicapped people}are treated at{Lea Castle Hospital}near Cookley either residentially or daily. Working people pay a{National Health {Insurance}contribution regularly from their income. In addition to this a proportional charge is made for dental and optical treatment. People in full-time education, retired people and expectant mothers are excluded from these charges.
